laboratory_examinations.findings: Clozapine was effective in treating the psychotic symptoms of schizophrenia, with Carlos eventually stabilized on a dose of 300 mg/day. The psychotic symptoms were observed to have remitted.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Carlos's psychotic symptoms improved noticeably after starting clozapine treatment, with the dosage increased to 300 mg/day over 10 weeks.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Fluvoxamine was commenced at 250 mg/day for 3 months but was ineffective in treating Carlos's obsessive-compulsive symptoms.
Clomipramine was administered at 225 mg/day for 3 months, but it did not effectively treat the obsessive-compulsive symptoms.
Lamotrigine was titrated to 200 mg/day and resulted in about a 40% decrease in obsessive-compulsive symptoms while psychotic symptoms remained in remission.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Carlos's obsessive-compulsive symptoms decreased after 10 weeks of lamotrigine treatment.
